definitions.definition: To deduce or come to a conclusion by being rational
To perform a process of deduction or of induction, in order to convince or to confute; to argue.
To arrange and present the reasons for or against; to examine or discuss by arguments; to debate or discuss.
definitions.example: I reasoned the matter with my friend.

definitions.definition: To support with reasons, as a request.
To persuade by reasoning or argument.
definitions.example: to reason one into a belief; to reason one out of his plan

definitions.definition: (with down) To overcome or conquer by adducing reasons.
(usually with out) To find by logical process; to explain or justify by reason or argument.
definitions.example: to reason out the causes of the librations of the moon

definitions.definition: The deduction of inferences or interpretations from premises; abstract thought; ratiocination.
A Rastafari meeting held for the purposes of chanting, prayer and discussion.
